intro: Corydalis tenuipes, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cooler climates. Its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves contribute to its graceful appearance. Corydalis tenuipes is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
